Sections.Hero: If you can't beat the AI, take the lead

GettingStarted.description: In this guide, we'll step-by-step create a simple neural network for image classification using Python and TensorFlow.

snippets.2: Import the MNIST dataset from TensorFlow and split it into training and testing datasets.
snippets.3: Then normalize the pixel values ​​by dividing them by 255.0 to convert them to a range of 0 to 1.
snippets.4: Create a model with Keras using the Serial API.
snippets.5: Compile the model by specifying the 'adam' optimizer, the 'sparse_categorical_crossentropy' loss function, and the 'accuracy' metric to evaluate the model's performance.
snippets.6: Train the model on the training data for 10 epochs to allow the model to adapt to the training data.
snippets.7: Evaluate the model on test data to see how well it can predict numbers on new images.
snippets.8: Save the trained model to the file 'mnist_model.h5' so that you can use it later for predictions without having to retrain.

1943.event: Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts create a model of a neuron, laying the foundations of neural networks.

1949.event: Alan Turing formulates the Turing test to evaluate the ability of machines to think.

1956.event: The term "artificial intelligence" is used for the first time at the Dartmouth conference.

1957.event: Allen Newell and Herbert Simon create General Problem Solver (GPS), the first program for solving problems from different domains.

1965.event: John McCarthy creates the Lisp programming language used in AI research.

1966.event: Joseph Weizenbaum creates ELIZA, a program that simulates a psychotherapist.

1972.event: The STUDENT program has been developed to solve algebra problems at the student level.

1974.event: The MYCIN program has been created for making diagnoses and prescribing treatment.

1980.event: Deep Thought beat the world chess champion.

1985.event: Eureka was created to solve problems using common sense.

1997.event: Deep Blue beat world chess champion Garry Kasparov.

1998.event: Watson could answer medical questions at the doctor level.

2005.event: DARPA Grand Challenge: Stanley self-driving car wins $1 million prize.

2011.event: IBM Watson won the TV game show Jeopardy!, beating two champions.

2012.event: Google X launched a self-driving car project.

2016.event: AlphaGo beat world champion Go player Lee Sedol.

2020.event: GPT-3 generates text that is indistinguishable from human-written text.

2021.event: AI weather forecasting is becoming more accurate and useful for disaster warning.

2022.event: Artificial intelligence is starting to play a key role in helping startups save costs.

2023.event: Growing interest in artificial intelligence in professional and educational contexts.

2024.event: Artificial intelligence is expected to play an even more significant role in business and education.

definition.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
definition.definition: is the ability of machines to think, learn and act like humans.

1.title: Input layer
1.description: This is the first layer that accepts inputs such as images or text.

2.title: Hidden layers
2.description: Hidden layers analyze the input data, applying weights to determine the importance of aspects of the data, allowing the network to learn and draw conclusions

3.title: Output layer
3.description: The output layer produces predictions or outputs using information from hidden layers to generate the final result.
